definition: ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: During the first season with Lakers, he didn't get many opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 在胡人對的第一個賽季，他沒有獲得很多的機會。

sentences.english: Donghu is a branch of the Hu people who act actively in the Northeast of Yan.
sentences.chinese: 東胡是東周時期活躍於燕國東北面的一支胡人。

sentences.english: After the mid-Tang, follow the barbarian bun become fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 中唐以後，效仿胡人髮髻成爲時尚。

sentences.english: Jade carved jade, much of a walk.
sentences.chinese: 青玉玉質，雕一行走的胡人。

definition: Han Chinese person or people
Turkic ethnic group
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Mongol
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Jie people, a tribe of northern China around the 4th century
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
Western Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms (400-421)
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Youzhou, ancient province in north Hebei and Liaoning/Fanyang 範陽|范阳 ancient city near modern Beijing
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
